0.title: Gyanvapi is a masjid & will remain so: Owaisi as survey pics leaked
0.article_body: After videos and pictures of the Gyanvapi mosque survey were leaked, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the footage which was being broadcasted on TV channels "could be doctored". "Even if it's genuine, Gyanvapi was a masjid...and will remain a masjid," he added. "Even Supreme Court judges have said that such details shouldn't be played in media," the AIMIM chief said.

1.title: Punjabi singer Mankirt requests security cover after Sidhu Moosewala's murder: Report
1.article_body: Punjabi singer Mankirt Aulakh has requested Punjab Police to increase his security cover after the murder of Sidhu Moosewala, according to a report by India Today. As per the report, he had received threats from the Davinder Bambiha gang. He had reportedly received death threats in April, due to which he has asked police to increase his security cover.

2.title: There will be new season but it will take time: Panchayat director on season 3
2.article_body: When asked if makers are planning a new season of 'Panchayat', director Deepak Kumar Mishra said they are planning a season three of the show, however, they aren't in any haste. "Right now, we have the responsibility of two seasons and thus we'll have to focus...on performances and script," he said. "Thus it will take its own time," he added.

3.title: 18-year-old Coco Gauff enters 1st Grand Slam semis at French Open
3.article_body: Coco Gauff, the 18-year-old, has advanced to the first Grand Slam semi-final of her career after beating fellow American and 2018 finalist Sloane Stephens at French Open on Tuesday. The 18th seed won the quarter-final match 7-5, 6-2. Gauff hasn't dropped a set in the tournament so far. She will now face another last-four debutant Martina Trevisan.

4.title: Assam govt delivers 1st instalment of PMAY to 15,000 beneficiaries
4.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday handed over the first instalment of ₹32,500 each of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) to around 15,000 beneficiaries of Sivasagar and Charaideo districts. "The government wants all sections of...society, regardless of their social strata, to be adequately served so that no one stays out of...reach of the government's welfare measures," Sarma said.

5.title: 500 civilians killed in attacks from January to March in Mali: UN
5.article_body: The UN in a report on Monday said that over 500 civilians died in attacks carried out by armed forces and Islamist groups in Mali from January to March of this year. The killings represented a 324% rise over the previous quarter, according to Reuters. Notably, the rise in the death toll comes amid a political crisis in Mali.

6.title: My kids wrote better code at 12: Musk on Dogecoin creator's script to detect bots
6.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said his "kids wrote better code when they were 12" than the script written by Dogecoin creator Jackson Palmer, which he claims can detect crypto scam in Twitter mentions and automatically report them. "If [the script is] so great, he (Palmer) should share it with the world and make everyone's experience with Twitter better," Musk tweeted.

7.title: Black box of crashed Tara Air plane recovered in Nepal
7.article_body: The black box of the Tara Air plane that crashed in Nepal's Mustang district on Sunday was recovered by a team of international and national mountain guides on Tuesday. The black box will be transported to Kathmandu. All 22 people, including four Indians, on board the plane were killed in the crash.

8.title: Khan's supporters at Azadi March had automatic rifles: Minister
8.article_body: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif on Monday claimed that protesters in ex-PM Imran Khan's 'Azadi March' were carrying weapons, including automatic rifles. "Imran Khan had asked protesters to bring weapons...however, the government was aware of that," Asif was quoted as saying by local media. Clashes broke out during Khan's rally on May 25, leading to the arrest of several people.

9.title: Go for no. 4: Vettori on Hardik's batting position in India's T20I squad
9.article_body: Picking a batting position for all-rounder Hardik Pandya ahead of India's upcoming T20I series against South Africa, Daniel Vettori said, "If you can fit him in at number four...go for it. That's the perfect position for him." He stated, "As of now, though, it feels like he's going to slot into number five, with Pant potentially dropping down to six."

10.title: Govt issues guidelines to states on managing monkeypox, lists symptoms to watch
10.article_body: The government has issued guidelines to states and UTs to manage monkeypox in view of its spread in non-endemic nations. It listed monkeypox symptoms- swollen lymph nodes, fever, headache, body aches and profound weakness. Anyone showing one or more of these symptoms with an unexplained acute rash and travel history to an affected country is a suspected case, it said.

11.title: Centre releases ₹86,912 cr to states, clears GST compensation dues
11.article_body: The Centre on Tuesday said it has released ₹86,912 crore to state governments, thereby clearing all GST compensation due to them. The Centre paid part of the compensation dues from its own resources as only about ₹25,000 crore was available in the GST compensation fund. Of the total compensation released, ₹47,617 crore was due up to January.

12.title: India fail to reach men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey final due to inferior goal difference
12.article_body: India were held to a 4-4 draw by South Korea in their last Super 4s stage match of men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey. India finished third on the points table in the Super 4s stage and failed to reach the final. Malaysia, South Korea and India finished with five points each, however, India had an inferior goal difference of +1.

13.title: Tillotama reacts to troll wanting to see her 'naked' like Rytasha
13.article_body: Actress Tillotama Shome shared a screenshot of a troll who sent her the message, "I want to see your nangi (naked) body pic like Rytasha Rathore." Tillotama responded, writing, "Why did this message...offend me so much? Is it because as a professional I struggle with intimacy and nudity on screen?...The power of the naked body...relates to protest and political action."

14.title: I hugged you & called you brother: Himanshi mourns Sidhu Moosewala's demise
14.article_body: Punjabi actress Himanshi Khurana took to Instagram to mourn the death of 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala who was killed in Punjab's Mansa. She wrote, "I hugged you and called you...brother...The next day you kept dinner for me in Canada...I noticed that you wore mismatched clothes but you had so much innocence, humbleness and simplicity in you."

15.title: World no. 59 Trevisan reaches 1st Grand Slam semi-final at French Open
15.article_body: World number 59 Martina Trevisan reached her first Grand Slam semi-final at French Open after defeating 17th seed Leylah Fernandez of Canada 6-2, 6-7(3-7), 6-3 in the quarter-final on Tuesday. She became the first Italian woman to reach the semi-finals at Roland Garros, since Sara Errani in 2013. Notably, this is her 10th consecutive win and third career top-20 victory.

16.title: India faces low stagflationary risks: CEA Nageswaran
16.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran on Tuesday said India faces low stagflationary risks as compared with the rest of the world. After data showed GDP growth in January-March quarter (Q4) slowed down to 4.1%, he said there's considerable momentum in economic activity. RBI's confidence to raise rates is a sign that economic recovery is taking hold, he added.

17.title: 3 arrested over shootout at K'taka theatre during KGF 2 screening
17.article_body: Three persons have been arrested from Bihar for allegedly supplying a gun to a man accused of shooting at another man at a cinema hall in Karnataka's Haveri, police said. The victim is currently recovering in a hospital. The incident has taken place following an altercation between the victim and the accused, while they were watching 'KGF: Chapter 2'.

18.title: 1st arrest made in Sidhu Moosewala murder case, accused sent to 5-day police custody
18.article_body: Two days after Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead, Punjab Police on Tuesday made the first arrest. Police formally arrested Manpreet Singh who was detained along with five others from Uttarakhand on Monday. Singh was produced before Mansa court today following which he was sent to custody for five days.

19.title: I quit 'Kyunki Saas...' as I wanted to be film actor: Amar Upadhyay
19.article_body: Actor Amar Upadhyay, known for portraying Mihir in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', said that he quit the show because he wanted to be a film actor. Amar said that he was the lead in three shows at the time and was also offered many films. "I kind of messed up as I was handling my dates," he added.

20.title: Prabhas is my darling, I've been a huge fan of South Indian cinema: Ranbir
20.article_body: During Brahmastra's event, actor Ranbir Kapoor said he has been a huge fan of South Indian cinema. "If it's Rajinikanth sir, Kamal Haasan sir...Jr NTR and Ram Charan are dear friends." When asked about his favourite actor, Ranbir said, "I love my darling Prabhas. He's a...dear friend of mine. All...are great. But if I had to choose one, I'll say...Prabhas."

21.title: Cong expresses displeasure over J'khand's RS poll nominee pick
21.article_body: Congress has expressed displeasure after coalition partner Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) picked its senior leader Mahua Maji as the candidate for upcoming Rajya Sabha polls from Jharkhand. Congress is upset over the "unilateral" move, state Congress in-charge Avinash Pande said. Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren, however, stated that the decision was taken after talks with Congress chief Sonia Gandhi.

22.title: If Musk can run 4 firms, why can't they?: WazirX VP on Co-founders' new ventures
22.article_body: WazirX Vice President Rajagopal Menon said the crypto exchange's Co-founders Siddharth Menon and Nischal Shetty are "very much around" but have started other ventures, after reports suggested they've shifted base to Dubai. He further said, "If you have Jack Dorsey who can run three companies, Elon Musk running 4-billion-dollar companies, why can't Indian founders run multiple companies?"

23.title: 8 BJP candidates from UP file nomination for Rajya Sabha elections
23.article_body: Eight BJP candidates from Uttar Pradesh filed their nominations for the Rajya Sabha elections on Tuesday. Those who filed their nominations included BJP's OBC Morcha national president K Laxman and ex-BJP state president Laxmikant Vajpayee. UP CM Yogi Adityanath, who was also present on the occasion, said, "Hearty congratulations...to all the respected candidates...Victory is sure for all of you."

24.title: BJP leadership warns Dilip Ghosh for criticising Bengal party leaders
24.article_body: BJP leader Dilip Ghosh has been criticised by the party's central leadership for speaking against a section of party leaders in West Bengal. "There have been some avoidable instances when some of your statements or outbursts have...caused embarrassment to the central leadership," BJP National General Secretary Arun Singh wrote in a letter, as per BJP National President JP Nadda's instructions.

25.title: Goa Police file chargesheet against Poonam, Sam in obscene video case
25.article_body: Goa Police has filed a chargesheet against actress Poonam Pandey and her ex-husband Sam Bombay in the 2020 obscene video case. The couple was booked for allegedly shooting an obscene video in the state-owned Chapoli Dam and circulating it on social media platforms in November 2020. Poonam and Sam were arrested following the incident and were later released on bail.

26.title: Liverpool forward Salah wins PFA Fans' Player of the Year award
26.article_body: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has been named this year's PFA Premier League Fans' Player of the Year. Notably, Salah has retained the award, winning it for the third time in his career. He scored 23 league goals in 2021-22 season to help his side finish second, behind Manchester City. Salah claimed his third Golden Boot, alongside Tottenham Hotspur's Son Heung-min.

27.title: New Zealand PM Ardern to meet US Prez Biden at White House
27.article_body: New Zealand's PM Jacinda Ardern will meet US President Joe Biden at the White House on Tuesday. After her arrival in the US, Ardern said that she expects to discuss ongoing US engagement in the Indo-Pacific region. "We'll be encouraging the US to...strengthen engagement in our region including economic engagement, which is really critical to our region," she added.

28.title: Mahindra & Mahindra plans IPO for unlisted arms in next 2 yrs: CEO
28.article_body: Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) will look at monetising its listed and unlisted companies by raising ₹2,000 crore over the next two years, said M&M MD and CEO Anish Shah. Unlisted firms will be on their path to an IPO, he added. M&M also raised its capital expenditure by ₹3,300 crore for auto and farm equipment units.

29.title: S Korean stars Park Shin Hye, Choi Tae Joon welcome baby boy
29.article_body: South Korean stars Park Shin Hye and Choi Tae Joon welcomed their first child on Tuesday. As per the statement by her agency, both Park Shin Hye and her son are in good health. The couple got married in January in a private ceremony in Seoul. They announced their marriage plans and pregnancy in November last year.

30.title: Gill is the only one I thought will be hard to bowl to: GT teammate Rashid
30.article_body: On being asked to name the batter he thinks is difficult to bowl to, GT spinner Rashid Khan said it's his teammate Shubman Gill. He added that he's lucky to have Gill on his side. "So proud to be here with him. With someone like him, it gives you lots of energy in the game," he further said.

31.title: Eritrean forces shell town in Ethiopia, 14-yr-old girl killed: UN
31.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was killed and at least 18 others were injured after Eritrean forces shelled a town in Ethiopia's Tigray region over the weekend, according to UN documents and Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF). Eritrean forces had fired 23 rounds into Ethiopia. Notably, Eritrea had supported Ethiopia's federal government in its fight against TPLF, which controls most of Tigray.

32.title: Punjab appoints Ishwar Singh as ADGP law & order 2 days after Moosewala's murder
32.article_body: The Punjab government on Tuesday appointed IPS officer and Additional Director General of Police (ADGP) Ishwar Singh as the new Additional Director General of Police (Law and Order). The post was vacant for seven days after Naresh Kumar was shifted by the state government. This comes two days after singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Mansa in broad daylight.

33.title: Cannes felt like a mela, I thought 'I'll set fire there': Hina Khan
33.article_body: Actress Hina Khan has spoken about her second appearance at the Cannes Film Festival, saying it felt like a "mela". "Wahan jaake aag lagni hai (I will set a fire there) was my thought," she added. The actress called the five minutes on the carpet magical, adding the media doesn't judge where you are from or what you have done.

34.title: Will try to pick brains of Mhambrey, Dravid: Arshdeep ahead of T20Is vs SA
34.article_body: Ahead of India's upcoming T20I series against South Africa, pacer Arshdeep Singh said he will try to pick the brains of India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey and head coach Rahul Dravid. "I will try to figure out what mental state the player should be in," he added. The 23-year-old was selected in India's 18-member squad for the five-match series.

35.title: Enforcement agencies misunderstand royalty fees: Tech industry body
35.article_body: India Cellular and Electronics Association (ICEA) has said India's enforcement agencies have a "lack of understanding" of royalty payments in the technology industry and has urged the Centre to intervene. In a letter to finance, trade and technology ministers, ICEA said enforcement agencies have taken "a stance that royalty is a simple way to take money out of India".

36.title: American supercomputer becomes world's fastest, beats Japan's 'Fugaku'
36.article_body: 'Frontier', a supercomputer built by Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), has been ranked the world's fastest, according to the TOP500 list. The supercomputer overtook Japan's 'Fugaku', which has topped the TOP500 list for the last two years. Further, 'Frontier' has reached 1.1 exaflops, making it the world's first supercomputer to break the exascale speed barrier, TOP500 said.

37.title: Played rapist in a film, people asked 'Are you enjoying?': Makarand Deshpande
37.article_body: Actor Makarand Deshpande spoke about playing the role of a rapist in a film and said that some people would ask him if he enjoyed doing a rape scene. "People came there to see the shooting and they asked me, 'Are you enjoying it?' I found that filthy," he added. "These are the people who enjoy such gruesomeness," Deshpande said.

38.title: Georgia's breakaway region shelves referendum on joining Russia
38.article_body: The leader of Georgia's breakaway region of South Ossetia on Monday shelved plans on holding  referendum to join Russia, which was slated to be held on July 17. The referendum, which was finalised by region's ex-leader, was cancelled for being 'premature', according to President Alan Gagloev. Russia recognised South Ossetia as independent after former fought war with Georgia in 2008.

39.title: Lawrence Bishnoi, accused in Moosewala murder, given additional security in jail
39.article_body: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, who's lodged in Delhi's Tihar Jail, has been given additional security after he has been named as an accused in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala. Bishnoi has moved the Delhi High Court fearing a 'fake encounter' by Punjab Police, seeking to stop the transfer of his custody. Bishnoi's gang members have claimed responsibility for killing Moosewala.

40.title: Pune builder Bhosale sent to CBI custody till June 8 in Yes Bank-DHFL case
40.article_body: A special CBI court in Mumbai on Tuesday remanded Pune-based builder and ABIL Group Chairman Avinash Bhosale to CBI custody till June 8 in an alleged corruption case. The case involves Yes Bank founder Rana Kapoor and Dewan Housing Finance Corporation Ltd (DHFL) promoter Kapil Wadhawan. The CBI arrested Bhosale on May 26.

41.title: Kashmiri Pandits protest J&K teacher's killing, warn of mass migration
41.article_body: Kashmiri Pandits staged a protest in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar after a female school teacher was shot dead by terrorists in Kulgam on Tuesday. They warned of mass relocation if the government failed to provide a solution amid the killings of innocents in Kashmir within 24 hours. The protesters demanded their relocation to a "safer place" until conditions turn normal.

42.title: Under-construction ceiling of B'luru hospital collapses; 4 rescued
42.article_body: The under-construction ceiling of St Martha's Hospital in Bengaluru collapsed on Tuesday, following which four labourers were left trapped under the debris. Three fire engines and a bulldozer rushed to the spot to rescue the injured workers, who were shifted to a hospital for treatment. Patients had been reportedly advised to avoid using that part, as construction work was underway.

43.title: Akshay, Manushi pay tribute to Samrat Prithviraj at Somnath temple; pic surfaces
43.article_body: Akshay Kumar, Manushi Chhillar and filmmaker Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi paid their respects at the historic Somnath temple today as a sign of salute to Samrat Prithviraj Chauhan's bravery and sacrifice. Chandraprakash Dwivedi said, "We brought Samrat Prithviraj’s flag to the temple and sought blessings at this holy...place...It's an incredible moment for us as a team."

44.title: Maha Congress leader quits post over 'outsider' pick for RS polls
44.article_body: Congress' Ashish Deshmukh on Tuesday resigned as General Secretary of Maharashtra Pradesh Congress Committee amid disappointment over the party's decision to nominate "outsider" Imran Pratapgarhi from Maharashtra in Rajya Sabha polls. "Imposing an outside candidate will not benefit the party...This is injustice towards...Congress workers in Maharashtra," Deshmukh said. Pratapgarhi hails from UP.

45.title: IIM alumnus gives glimpse of 3 Idiots shoot locations at college, share pics
45.article_body: Actors Aamir Khan, R Madhavan and Sharman Joshi's film '3 Idiots' was filmed in IIM Bangalore. Taking to Instagram, an IIM Bangalore alumnus shared the photos of the real-life locations seen in the movie. The pictures compared scenes from the film to the real-life campus of the institute. He captioned it, "IIM Bangalore X 3 idiots series."

46.title: Why was security cut, how did info come out: HC to Punjab govt after Moosewala death
46.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has asked the Punjab government to explain the basis on which security was reduced for around 400 people including deceased singer Sidhu Moosewala. The state government will also have to explain how the report of security withdrawal became public. This came on Punjab's ex-Deputy CM OP Soni's plea after his security cover was reduced.

47.title: Lesbian couple forcibly separated by families allowed to live together by Kerala HC
47.article_body: Kerala High Court allowed a lesbian couple, both adults in their early 20s, to live together. They had been forcibly separated by their families with one of them allegedly being forced into conversion therapy. The bench asked them whether they wanted to live together. Both replied in affirmative after which the court passed the order in their favour.

48.title: Rainfall this monsoon expected to be 103% of average: IMD
48.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) Director General Mrutyunjay Mohapatra on Tuesday said average rainfall this monsoon is expected to be 103% of the long period average, which is considered as normal rainfall. He said central India and south peninsula are set to receive above normal rainfall. This is the fourth consecutive year that India is likely to experience a normal monsoon.

49.title: Russia, Gulf Cooperation Council states to hold talks on Wednesday
49.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov will meet the Foreign Ministers of the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) states in Saudi Arabia on Wednesday, two Gulf officials said on Tuesday. Notably, the ministers from Saudi Arabia, the UAE, Oman, Kuwait, Qatar and Bahrain will hold online talks with the Ukrainian Foreign Minister after their meeting with Lavrov, the officials added.

50.title: Inflation in EU countries hits 8.1% in May, highest since 1997
50.article_body: Inflation in 19 European Union countries hit an all-time high of 8.1% in May, authorities said. Inflation, which is at its highest level since 1997, was driven by a rise in food and energy prices after Russia's invasion of Ukraine sent commodity prices soaring. Core inflation, which excludes volatile components like food, energy and alcohol, rose to 3.8% in May.

51.title: Govt should regulate songs on gangs, gun culture: Daler on Sidhu's death
51.article_body: Singer Daler Mehndi condoled singer Sidhu Moosewala's death, saying that he never heard his songs but heard his name because he was so popular. Daler further urged the government to regulate songs that promote drugs, gangs and gun culture or use bad words for women. "Such songs should be given warning...All this can get controlled if this happens," he added.

52.title: Driver sets taxi stand on fire as its owner scolds him in Delhi; 5 injured
52.article_body: A taxi driver set a taxi stand on fire after its owner allegedly scolded him and misbehaved with him in Delhi, police said. Five people who were sleeping at the taxi stand were injured in the incident, police said, adding that the man has been arrested. A case has been registered in this regard.

53.title: Man finds rubber band in KFC chicken in Hyd; KFC apologises
53.article_body: A Hyderabad-based civic activist, Sai Teja, on Monday took to Twitter and claimed that he found a rubber band in a chicken dish he ordered from KFC through Swiggy. Teja also shared the pictures of the same on Twitter. Reacting to his tweet, KFC India and Swiggy issued an apology and sought details to address his concern.

54.title: Water found unfit for drinking in Gurugram society as 90 fall ill
54.article_body: After over 90 residents of Westend Heights in Gurugram's DLF Phase 5 fell sick, water samples collected from the society were tested unfit for human consumption, an official said. Gurugram's Chief Medical Officer, Virender Yadav, said, "Residents should immediately stop consuming the water for drinking purposes." However, the society's Residents' Welfare Association contradicted the findings.

55.title: Viswanathan Anand beats world number one Magnus Carlsen in chess blitz event
55.article_body: Indian Grandmaster Viswanathan Anand defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in seventh round of the blitz event of Norway Chess. Anand finished off at the fourth position with five points in the event. American Grandmaster Wesley So won the blitz event with 6.5 points. Earlier this month, 16-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa had defeated Carlsen in an online rapid chess tournament.

56.title: Hindustan Unilever CEO Sanjiv Mehta's salary jumps 47% to ₹22 crore in 2021-22
56.article_body: Sanjiv Mehta, the CEO and MD of Hindustan Unilever (HUL), received a salary of ₹22 crore in 2021-22, marking a 47% jump from ₹15 crore in 2020-21. Mehta's total compensation included ₹3.7 crore salary, ₹9.2 crore in allowances, ₹4.3 crore bonus and ₹4.2 crore as perquisite. In 2019-20, Mehta was the highest-paid FMCG CEO, with a salary of ₹19.42 crore.

57.title: OTT has to be different from what I'm chasing in films: Arjun
57.article_body: On being asked about making his debut on OTT platforms, actor Arjun Kapoor said that it has to be very specific because he can't do in theatres what he will do on OTT. "It has to be different from what I'm chasing in films. Sometimes you have to keep waiting to find something exciting," the actor added.

58.title: Dead calf carried by mother elephant for 7 km in WB sent for autopsy
58.article_body: The carcass of a calf that a mother elephant carried for at least seven kilometres in tea gardens of West Bengal's Jalpaiguri district three days ago was recovered by wildlife officials. The cause of the calf's death is yet to be ascertained, the officials said, adding that the carcass has been sent for post-mortem.

59.title: BJP is afraid of Congress party's ideology: P Chidambaram
59.article_body: On being asked whether the BJP-led Union government is afraid of him, senior Congress leader P Chidambaram said the BJP is afraid of his party's ideology and not him. He said, "I'm not a tiger...to be afraid of...I'm an ordinary human being, reflecting the Congress." "I don't think they are afraid of me…they fear the Congress party's ideology," he added.

60.title: India wants job security, not 'racial purity': Rahul Gandhi
60.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said the country wants job security and economic prosperity, not "racial purity". Reacting to a news report on Culture Ministry's plan to study "racial purity", Gandhi said, "The last time a country had a culture ministry studying 'racial purity', it didn't end well." The Culture Ministry called the news report "mischievous and misleading".

61.title: India's GDP grows 8.7% in 2021-22 compared to 6.6% contraction in 2020-21
61.article_body: India's GDP grew 8.7% in the financial year 2021-22, as compared to a contraction of 6.6% in 2020-21, as per provisional estimates released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation on Tuesday. In January-March quarter (Q4), the GDP growth slowed to 4.1%, compared to a 5.4% growth during the October-December quarter (Q3) of 2021-2022.

62.title: My character Shiva in 'Brahmāstra' is a DJ: Ranbir Kapoor
62.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has revealed at a press event in Vizag that he portrays a DJ in Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmāstra'. Ranbir further said, "I play the character of Shiva...who is born with a certain strange connection with fire." The actor added that the film is about his journey into the world of ancient astras. The film also stars Alia Bhatt.

63.title: Request farmers to plant more rice: Sri Lanka amid food shortage
63.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's ongoing economic crisis, the government has urged farmers to plant more rice in their fields. Sri Lanka is likely to experience severe food crisis by August as it needs an estimated $600 million to import fertilisers amid a forex shortage, PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has warned. Additionally, the country is facing a shortage of fuel and medicine supplies.

64.title: No closure report filed against Delhi minister Satyendar Jain: CBI
64.article_body: The CBI on Tuesday refuted reports claiming it had filed a closure report against Delhi minister Satyendar Jain in a disproportionate assets case. AAP MP Sanjay Singh had on Monday claimed Jain was already given a clean chit by CBI in the case. Jain has been sent to Enforcement Directorate's custody till June 9 in an alleged money laundering case.

65.title: It was important to move on: Kanika on recovering from failure of 1st marriage
65.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor spoke about how one failed marriage didn't wreck her idea of marriage. Kanika said her parents "lived a happy married life throughout". "Sometimes you can be in a marriage with a partner who doesn't understand you and vice versa," she added. Kanika further said it was important to move on and live a life without any hatred.

66.title: It's the end of another great season of IPL: BCCI President Ganguly
66.article_body: Following the recently concluded IPL 2022, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly took to Twitter and wrote, "It's the end of another great season of IPL...congratulations to all the teams." He added, "Special congratulations to Gujarat Titans for winning the trophy." Hardik Pandya led-GT beat RR by seven wickets to win the IPL title in their debut season.

67.title: Will address issue of uprooting of trees during storms: Delhi LG
67.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena on Tuesday said he will address the issue of uprooting of trees during thunderstorms in Delhi. Taking to Twitter, Saxena said he shares the concern about the maintenance and upkeep of trees and how their uprooting affects Delhi's traffic. "We have taken the matter seriously and will address it at the earliest," he added.

68.title: Unknown man's body with several wounds found under bridge in Thane
68.article_body: Police said that the body of an unidentified man with multiple wounds was found in Maharashtra's Thane. An official from Shil-Daighar Police Station said that on reaching the spot, the police found a paver block near the body and a car nearly 60 metres away. This raised suspicion that the man was killed by miscreants who tried to rob him.

69.title: India's borders more secure than they were before 2014: PM Modi
69.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said the country's borders have become more secure than they were before 2014. He said, "Before 2014, there was concern about the security of the country, today we're proud of the surgical strike-air strike." PM Modi said this while addressing a rally in Shimla to mark the eighth anniversary of BJP government at the centre.

70.title: 33-yr-old man strangles his girlfriend, kills self in Thane
70.article_body: Police said that a 33-year-old man allegedly strangled his girlfriend to death and later killed himself in Maharashtra's Thane. An official said the incident took place when 33-year-old Anil Salunke visited the victim, 28-year-old Lalita Kale, at her apartment. Salunke was upset that Kale was marrying another man and went to meet her for the last time, the official added.

71.title: Couple, daughters aged 6 & 9 die by suicide near Hyderabad
71.article_body: A couple and their two daughters allegedly died by suicide after jumping into Kurmalguda lake near Hyderabad. The deceased have been identified as Quddus Pasha (37), Fatima (28), Mehar (nine) and Firdous Begum (six). They allegedly consumed a poisonous substance before jumping into the lake.

72.title: Gurugram Police arrests maid for stealing ₹16 lakh from ex-employer
72.article_body: The Gurugram Police on Monday said that a maid was arrested for stealing jewellery worth ₹15 lakh and cash worth ₹1 lakh from the house of her ex-employer in Sector 50. The stolen cash and jewellery were recovered from her possession, the police added. The husband of the accused, a suspect in the case, is absconding, the police further said.

73.title: 'Goldy Brar' who posted pic with Mann clarifies he's not the gangster, says 'Pic misused'
73.article_body: A man named Goldy Brar from Punjab clarified he's not the gangster Goldy Brar, suspected to be behind Sidhu Moosewala's murder. "I'm Goldy Brar, son of Rajinder Singh from...Jandwala. My picture is being misused on social media," he said. The man had posted a congratulatory message for Bhagwant Mann after he became CM and had posted a photo with him.

74.title: PM stops car to accept portrait of his mother from girl in Shimla
74.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday broke his high-security protocol to accept a portrait of his mother made by a girl in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla. The incident took place when PM Modi was taking part in a roadshow. Seeing the girl carrying the sketch of his mother, the PM asked for his car to be stopped to meet her.

75.title: Gandhi family always cheated people of Amethi: Smriti Irani
75.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday alleged that the Gandhi family did politics from Uttar Pradesh's Amethi for decades, but kept the constituency's people "poor". "The Gandhi family always cheated people of Amethi," she claimed. Furthermore, she alleged that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had "left for Kerala in 2019" as he knew Amethi's people had "resentment" against the Gandhi family.

76.title: Demonetisation caused harm, people won't forget: Rahul to PM Modi
76.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said people will never forget the pain of demonetisation. In a Facebook post, Gandhi said the demonetisation exercise, introduced by PM Narendra Modi's government in 2016, was done "deliberately so that lakhs of crores of loans of 'Modi-friend' capitalists can be waived" off. Many died while waiting in line for money, he added.

77.title: We are secure, rumours don't affect us: Shamita on break-up reports with Raqesh
77.article_body: Actress Shamita Shetty reacted to the rumours of her break-up with her boyfriend Raqesh Bapat. She said, "We (Raqesh and I) have consciously made an effort to not let these things affect us too much." "A relationship is about two people...It can't be about the rest of the world...We both are very secure people...so it doesn’t affect us," she added.

78.title: AAP, Cong create propaganda, defame ED: BJP MP on Satyendar Jain's arrest
78.article_body: BJP MP Jugal Lokhandwala on Monday said Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and Congress "deliberately create propaganda to defame the Enforcement Directorate (ED)". His comments came after AAP claimed that party leader Satyendar Jain was arrested by ED in a "fake case". "The ED is doing its work...this is your political stunt, it's not going to work," Jugal added.

79.title: US Senator visits Taiwan as China ups military threat
79.article_body: US Senator Tammy Duckworth on Tuesday reiterated America's support for Taiwan on her second visit in a year to the island. Duckworth met Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen during the trip. China denounced the visit and said, "Taiwan is a province of China, and there's no so-called President." Thirty Chinese military jets had entered Taiwan's air defence zone on Monday.

80.title: 20,000 tickets unsold at Lord's ahead of Eng-NZ 1st Test: Reports
80.article_body: Almost 20,000 tickets have reportedly gone unsold for the first four days of the Test match between England and New Zealand at the Lord's Cricket Ground, London. As per a Daily Telegraph report, the Barmy Army has cited higher prices as the reason behind sluggish sales. "1,800 tickets available on day one, 2,500 on day two," the report said.

81.title: Federer has always been my idol growing up: 19-year-old Rune
81.article_body: Holger Rune, who became the first Danish man to reach quarter-finals at French Open, said 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer has been his idol growing up. "Why I love him so much is basically his game, his transition to...net is very rare," he added. The 19-year-old beat world number four Stefanos Tsitsipas in Roland Garros fourth round on Monday.

82.title: 22-yr-old jailed for creating nuisance in drunken condition in Hyd
82.article_body: Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday took to Twitter to inform that a 22-year-old man has been convicted in a petty case for creating nuisance in drunken condition and misbehaving with ladies in the city. Police further said that a court has sentenced the man, who has been identified as Bandi Akash, to 112 days of imprisonment in the case.

83.title: Govt land worth ₹5 cr freed of encroachments in MP's Jabalpur
83.article_body: The district administration in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur removed encroachments on around 24,340 sq ft of government land on Tuesday. According to an official, the land has a market value of ₹5 crore. These encroachments were removed in joint action by district administration, the police and municipal corporation under state government's initiative, said Additional Collector Namah Shivay Arjaria.

84.title: 2-day-old infant girl found inside Mumbai garbage bin, case lodged
84.article_body: A two-day-old infant girl was found abandoned inside a garbage bin in Mumbai's Mahim area on Tuesday. Following the recovery of the baby, a case has been registered against an unknown person for leaving the infant in the garbage bin near a cloth market area. Police are searching for the accused using CCTV footage.

85.title: US' National Guard may cooperate with Taiwan military: Prez Tsai
85.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen said on Tuesday that the US' National Guard is mulling cooperation with Taiwan's armed forces. President Tsai's comment comes days after US President Joe Biden pledged that the US will defend Taiwan militarily in case China invades it. Notably, Taiwan has claimed that 30 Chinese warplanes entered its air defence zone on May 30.

86.title: My journey in B'wood has always been hard, difficult: Actress Aishwarya Raj
86.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Raj Bhakuni who will be seen in the upcoming Akshay Kumar starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj', said her journey in Bollywood has "always" been hard and difficult. "When I came to Mumbai, I had no clue where I had to go. I had no godfather," added Aishwarya Raj. "It took me six years to reach here," she stated.

87.title: Not much difference: UP CM after Akhilesh said a child called him Rahul Gandhi
87.article_body: Reacting to Akhilesh Yadav's claim that a child called him Rahul Gandhi when he was the CM, the current UP CM Yogi Adityanath said that there is not much difference between the two. "The only little difference is that Rahul Gandhi criticises India in foreign countries, while you (Akhilesh) do the same for UP when outside the state," he added.

88.title: Students unable to afford high fees going to countries like Ukraine: SC
88.article_body: The students who cannot afford to pay the high cost of medical courses are going to countries such as Ukraine, the Supreme Court said. Education has become a big industry in the country, SC added. The observation was made by the court while hearing a batch of pleas asking the government to process applications for setting up new pharmacy colleges.

89.title: 60-yr-old father, 26-yr-old son found dead in UP's Ballia
89.article_body: A man and his son were found dead in Sonavani village of Uttar Pradesh's Ballia district. The deceased, identified as Uma Shankar Singh (60) and Vikram Singh (26), were found in separate places in the village. Vikram's body was found inside a well while his father Uma's body was found at the family residence, police said.

90.title: 2 killed, 13 injured after minibus fell into gorge in Uttarkashi
90.article_body: Two persons were reportedly killed and 13 injured after a minibus they were travelling in fell into a 100-metre-deep gorge near Kopang Bend in Uttarkashi on Sunday. The deceased have been identified as Alka Bote, a doctor from Maharashtra's Aurangabad and Kartik Madhavan, a journalist from Coimbatore who worked for The Hindu, an official said. They were travelling to Gangotri.

91.title: Zomato shares surge over 48% in May, m-cap nears ₹60,000 crore
91.article_body: Shares of Zomato have surged over 48% in May with its total market capitalisation at ₹59,052 crore after the stock closed at ₹75 on Tuesday. The stock had hit a low of ₹50 apiece on May 11. Last week, Zomato announced its March quarter earnings and reported a loss of ₹360 crore and a 75% increase in consolidated revenue.

92.title: Raj Thackeray hospitalised in Mumbai, to undergo hip surgery tomorrow
92.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray has been admitted to the Lilavati Hospital in Mumbai and he will undergo hip surgery on Wednesday, party leader Nitin Sardesai said. Thackeray had earlier this month said that he will undergo surgery for his knee and back problems. Recently, he had given a deadline to remove loudspeakers from mosques.

93.title: Actor Karan V Grover to tie the knot with Poppy Jabbal on June 1: Reports
93.article_body: Actor Karan V Grover is all set to tie the knot with his longtime actress-girlfriend Poppy Jabbal on June 1, according to reports. The wedding will reportedly take place in Himachal Pradesh in the presence of family members and friends. As per reports, actresses Shama Sikander and Sonnalli Seygall are among the people who have been invited to the wedding.

94.title: Johnny Depp performs with Jeff Beck in UK for second night in a row
94.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp performed with English guitarist Jeff Beck for the second night in a row on Monday at London's Royal Albert Hall. Jeff introduced Johnny saying, "He came knocking on my dressing room door about five years ago and we haven't stopped laughing since." This comes amid the jury's deliberation in Johnny's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard.

95.title: Can't mention Ronaldinho, Gareth Bale in same sentence: Rio Ferdinand
95.article_body: Ex-Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said Real Madrid forward Gareth Bale and ex-Barcelona footballer Ronaldinho's names cannot be mentioned in the same sentence. Ferdinand added that Bale has had a "ridiculous" career, stating he is above Ronaldinho while considering Champions League success. He said the moments Ronaldinho has had in his career will live with generations of people forever.

96.title: BJP will do horse-trading and spoil atmosphere: Gehlot on RS polls
96.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that BJP will do horse-trading in the upcoming Rajya Sabha elections and spoil atmosphere of the state. "BJP fielded Subhash Chandra. They know they don't have sufficient votes so what will they do," he added. Randeep Singh Surjewala, Mukul Wasnik, and Pramod Tiwari have filed nominations as Congress candidates for Rajya Sabha polls from Rajasthan.

97.title: He has got all these opportunities: CM Nitish on not sending RCP Singh to RS
97.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar commented on his party JD(U)'s decision to not field Union Minister RCP Singh for the next month's Rajya Sabha biennial election. "He (RCP) has been sent to RS twice. He was also made JD(U) President and he is currently a minister in the Central government. So he has got all these opportunities," CM Nitish Kumar said.

98.title: BJP workers march towards TN Secretariat over tax on fuel prices
98.article_body: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai and party workers marched towards the state's Secretariat in Chennai in a protest over DMK-led state government not reducing tax on fuel prices on Tuesday. DMK promised to reduce the petrol and diesel prices "by ₹5 and ₹4 respectively" in its manifesto, Annamalai said. "We demand...state government to fulfil what it's promised," he added.

99.title: Man with rifle arrested after standoff with police outside Greek Parliament
99.article_body: A 37-year-old man carrying a hunting rifle has been arrested after a brief standoff with police outside the Greek Parliament. Tuesday's incident lasted a little over an hour and no one was injured, an official said. Last year in October, a 58-year-old man was arrested after driving a pickup truck onto a sidewalk in front of Parliament.

100.title: Many singers in Punjab give money and save themselves from gangsters: Mika Singh
100.article_body: Singer Mika Singh, in an interaction with News18, revealed that many singers in Punjab who are extorted by gangsters often end up paying them off. "Singers in Punjab often get such threats from gangsters...Many singers give money and save themselves," he stated. "Everyone knows they do so many shows and earn well," Mika added.

101.title: Kevin Pietersen picks his Team of IPL 2022, includes 5 overseas players
101.article_body: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen has picked his Team of IPL 2022, which includes five foreign players. He named Jos Buttler and Quinton De Kock as the openers of the team. He included Hardik Pandya as captain. Other players include KL Rahul, Liam Livingstone, Ravichandran Ashwin, David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Umran Malik, Yuzvendra Chahal and Josh Hazlewood.

102.title: Gyanvapi survey pics & videos leaked, aired on TV after being given to petitioners
102.article_body: After the videos and pictures of the Gyanvapi Mosque survey were handed over to four female Hindu petitioners on Monday, the same were leaked and aired on TV channels and circulated online. The Varanasi district court gave sealed envelopes containing survey footage to the petitioners who submitted an affidavit promising not to leak them. They've denied leaking the footage.

103.title: Was honour to play opposite Sam, Laura & Jeff in 'Jurassic...': Chris
103.article_body: Actor Chris Pratt has said that it was an honour to work opposite Jeff Goldblum, Laura Dern and Sam Neill in 'Jurassic World Dominion'. "I loved Jurassic Park growing up...they were cemented in my mind as icons at a period in my life when I didn't even know what I was going to do for a living," he added.

104.title: Shiba Inu's anonymous Founder Ryoshi deletes all tweets, blogs
104.article_body: Shiba Inu's anonymous Founder Ryoshi has deleted all their tweets and Shiba Inu blogs from Medium website. In a now-deleted post, Ryoshi had said, "I am a nobody, I am not important...I am just some guy of no consequence...and I am replaceable." Rysohi's Twitter profile picture has been changed to include a picture of Buddhist yogi Jetsun Milarepa.

105.title: Delhi court summons Congress' Shivakumar in money laundering case
105.article_body: A Delhi court has summoned Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar in a money laundering case after taking cognisance of a chargesheet filed by ED. The court has directed him to appear before it on July 1. The case pertains to a 2018 chargesheet filed by the Income Tax Department against Shivakumar and others for alleged tax evasion and hawala dealings.

106.title: Siberian tundra could virtually disappear by mid-millennium: Research
106.article_body: As a result of rising temperatures in Arctic due to global warming, the treeline for Siberian larch forests is steadily advancing to the north. Experts warned that Siberian tundra could virtually disappear by mid-millennium as these forests are gradually supplanting the broad expanses of the region. Only consistent climate protection measures could roughly save 30% of the tundra, they said.

107.title: 1 dead, 62 fall sick after drinking contaminated water in K'taka
107.article_body: Raichur Institute of Medical Sciences Superintendent Dr Bhaskar K on Tuesday said one person was dead and 62 others, including 23 children, have been hospitalised after they consumed contaminated water in Karnataka's Raichur city. The people were hospitalised due to dehydration, following vomiting and diarrhoea. Locals alleged that the district administration was not responding to their appeals.

108.title: International institutions accepting poverty is reducing in India: PM
108.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that today India extends its hand for help and international institutions are also accepting that poverty is reducing in India. "In COVID-19, we sent medicines and vaccines to over 150 countries," PM Modi said in Shimla. "India has proved that we have the potential and we are also the performers," PM Modi added.

109.title: Singaporeans rush to stock up chicken as Malaysia bans exports
109.article_body: The Singaporeans reportedly rushed to stock up on fresh chicken, clearing out supermarkets, as Malaysia's ban on poultry export is set to kick in from Wednesday. The ban was announced by Malaysian PM Ismail Sabri Yaakob last week in a bid to let domestic prices and production stabilise. Notably, Singapore procures a third of its poultry requirements from Malaysia.

110.title: Salman's security increased after Lawrence Bishnoi accused in Moosewala murder
110.article_body: Actor Salman Khan's security has been increased after gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, who threatened him in 2018, emerged as an accused in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala. "Police will be present around [Salman's] apartment (in Mumbai) to make sure no nefarious activity is done," said a police official. Bishnoi had threatened Salman in Rajasthan in retaliation for alleged blackbuck poaching.

111.title: France bans use of English video gaming terms like 'e-sports' and 'streaming'
111.article_body: The French government is officially banning the use of English video gaming terms to preserve the purity of French language. As per the AFP, government officials will now be required to replace words such as 'e-sports' and 'streaming' with their approved French versions. France's Culture Ministry said the use of English terms could become a "barrier to understanding" for non-gamers.

112.title: 5 killed, 5 injured as mini-bus collides with auto-rickshaw in Gujarat
112.article_body: At least five people were killed and five others were injured after a mini-bus collided with an auto-rickshaw in Gujarat's Banaskantha, police said. The deceased include three women, in the age group of 20 to 50 years, a man and a 10-year-old boy, police added. The mini-bus was coming from Rajasthan when it collided head-on with the auto-rickshaw, police stated.

113.title: Report claims Culture Ministry to study 'racial purity' of Indians, govt says 'misleading'
113.article_body: The government on Tuesday said that a media report titled "Culture Ministry to study 'racial purity' of Indians" published on May 28 is misleading, mischievous and contrary to the facts. "The proposal is not related to establishing genetic history and 'trace the purity of races in India' as alluded in the article," the Ministry of Culture said in a statement.

114.title: B'wood has always seen me more as a glamorous person: Sonali
114.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre has said that the Hindi film industry has always seen her more as a glamorous person than as a serious actor. "I want that to change," she added. Sonali further said she has nothing against glamour and loves being glamorous, while adding, "But there is more to me. And I would like those layers to be explored."

115.title: The team invested 2 years on VFX of 'Samrat Prithviraj': Akshay
115.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has said that the makers of his upcoming film 'Samrat Prithviraj' invested two years of the pandemic on the VFX work of the film. The actor added that the film is truly a "visual extravaganza" as the "grandest tribute to the fearless king". He had earlier said that his costumes in the film weighed about 4-6 kg.

116.title: There will be 'no entry' for BJP in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: Mamata
116.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that no matter how much the BJP tries there will be "no entry" for the party in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "There are no chances of the BJP returning to power," she said. "The citizens of the country are fed up with the anti-people government at the Centre," she further said.

117.title: Much of acting I know is what he taught me: Rasika on FTII professor Naseeruddin
117.article_body: Actress Rasika Dugal spoke about the opportunity of collaborating with her Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) professor Naseeruddin Shah in 'The Miniaturist of Junagadh'. "One of the reasons was of course Naseer saheb. He taught me when I was [at] FTII and much that I know of acting today is because of what he taught me," she said.

118.title: There is truly no one like you: Mahesh Babu on his father's b'day
118.article_body: Taking to Instagram on Tuesday, actor Mahesh Babu wished his father and veteran actor Krishna on his 79th birthday. "Happy birthday Nanna! There is truly no one like you. Wishing for your happiness and good health for many more years to come. Stay blessed always. Love you," he wrote. Recently, Mahesh had featured in 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata'.

119.title: I didn't click Depp-Heard honeymoon pic, shared it online: Russel Wong
119.article_body: Singaporean photographer Russel Wong shared the honeymoon picture of Johnny Depp and Amber Heard which shows a bruise under Depp's eye. Wong has stated that he did not click the picture, however, he did find the original picture as well as copies which showed Depp's bruise. Heard had claimed in the defamation trial against her that Depp Photoshopped the bruise.

120.title: Before 2014, talks were on scams, 'atki, latki, bhatki' schemes: PM
120.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday claimed that before 2014, talks used to be about things like scams, corruption, nepotism and "atki, latki, bhatki (stuck, hanging, derailed)" schemes. "But today talks are about benefits from govt schemes," he said. PM Modi made the remarks while addressing a meeting in Shimla as BJP-led government marks eight years at the Centre.

121.title: Southwest monsoon likely to reach Karnataka on June 2
121.article_body: The southwest monsoon is likely to reach Karnataka on June 2 (Thursday), the India Meteorological Department has said. The onset of monsoon showers might be delayed by three-four days over southern Karnataka but the entire state can expect rains from June 7, it added. Monsoon reached Kerala on Sunday, three days ahead of its onset.

122.title: 2 men rob Sudanese national of ₹2.72 lakh in Noida's Sector 128
122.article_body: A Sudanese national was robbed of $3,500 (nearly ₹2.72 lakh) by two men in Noida's Sector 128 on Sunday, according to a police official. The men had shown fake police IDs to 35-year-old Abu Bakr and searched him for drugs, the official said. They stole the money from the victim's wallet during the search and fled, the official added.

123.title: Israel signs trade deal with UAE, first-ever with an Arab state
123.article_body: Israel has signed a free trade agreement with the United Arab Emirates (UAE), its first with an Arab country. The pact was signed on Tuesday by both the countries' Economic Ministers. The deal would remove tariffs on 96% of goods. Two-way trade between Israel and the UAE last year totalled some $900 million, according to Israeli figures.

124.title: India's fiscal deficit at 6.7% of GDP in 2021-22
124.article_body: The central government's fiscal deficit stood at 6.7% of the GDP (gross domestic product) for 2021-22, lower than 6.9% estimated by the Ministry of Finance in the revised Budget 2022 estimates. During Budget 2022, the fiscal deficit was revised to ₹15.91 lakh crore. According to data shared on Tuesday, India's fiscal deficit for the financial year was ₹15.87 lakh crore.

125.title: Kerala woman thrashes drunk man in public for molesting her in bus
125.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing a young woman thrashing a man after the latter allegedly molested and abused her in a public bus in Kerala's Wayanad. As per reports, the man was in a drunken state. The incident took place when the woman, who was on her way to her office, asked him to move to a different seat.

126.title: Sri Lanka's inflation surges to record 39.1% in May amid economic crisis
126.article_body: Amid the nation's worst economic crisis, consumer prices in Sri Lanka’s Colombo in May rose to 39.1% from a year ago, said the Department of Census and Statistics. Meanwhile, food inflation surged 57.4% and non-food items jumped 30.6%, according to the data. Sri Lanka has defaulted on its $51 billion foreign debt and is seeking urgent assistance from the IMF.

127.title: Didn't perform the way we wanted, but excited about next year: MI's Sams
127.article_body: Talking about MI's performance in IPL 2022, all-rounder Daniel Sams said his side didn't perform the way they would've liked. "But we're excited about what's to come next year," he added. Five-time champions MI had their worst-ever season as they finished last in the standings for the first time in their IPL history. MI won four out of 14 matches.

128.title: Noida's Attero to spend $1 bn on battery recycling plants in US, Poland
128.article_body: Noida-based battery recycling company Attero Recycling is planning to invest $1 billion over five years to build lithium-ion battery recycling plants in Poland, the US and Indonesia. It also plans to prepare for an IPO in about a year and list in India or the US, later. Attero's Poland factory will be operational by the fourth quarter of 2022.

129.title: Shopkeeper’s son from village in Maharashtra cracks UPSC exam
129.article_body: A shopkeeper’s son, Rameshwar Sudhakar Sabbanwad, from a village in Maharashtra’s Latur, has cracked the Civil Services Examination, 2021. Sabbanwad, a resident of Handarguli village, secured 202nd rank in the results announced by the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) on Monday. According to Sabbanwad, he cleared the UPSC exam in his second attempt.

130.title: Security forces destroy 620 acres of opium farming in Bihar in a year
130.article_body: Security forces destroyed 620 acres of opium farming across three districts in Bihar in the past one year, a police official said on Tuesday. Opium farming in Jamui, Aurangabad and Gaya districts is turning out to be major source of revenue for Naxals, he added. "The revenue generated through opium farming is used for purchasing arms and ammunition," he said.

131.title: Sidhu Moosewala came to Mumbai last week, said 'I feel safe here': Mika
131.article_body: Mika Singh, recalling his last conversation with late singer Sidhu Moosewala, shared, "Last week he came to Mumbai, and I offered him my car to travel around in." "He told me, 'Brother, I feel safe here even without a security guard. People aren't staring. There's no tension'," Mika added.

132.title: Most reprehensible act: J&K LG after woman teacher killed in Kulgam
132.article_body: J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha condemned the killing of Rajni Bala, a 36-year-old Kashmiri Pandit teacher who was shot dead by terrorists in Kulgam on Tuesday. "Terrorist attack on...Bala is the most reprehensible act. My deepest condolences to the bereaved family," Sinha's office tweeted. "Terrorists and their sympathizers will be given unforgettable response for dastardly attack," it added.

133.title: 2 Russian soldiers sentenced to 11.5 years in jail over war crimes
133.article_body: A Ukrainian court on Tuesday sentenced two Russian soldiers, found guilty of war crimes, to 11 and a half years in jail. The soldiers - Alexander Bobikin and Alexander Ivanov - were part of an artillery unit that carried out shelling in the Kharkiv region which resulted in the destruction of an educational facility, according to the prosecutors.

134.title: Nirmala Sitharaman files nomination for Rajya Sabha from Karnataka
134.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman filed her nomination for Rajya Sabha elections as BJP candidate from Karnataka's Vidhana Soudha (Legislative Assembly). Prior to filing the nomination, Sitharaman visited the Gavi Gangadhareshwara Temple in Bengaluru. Sitharaman thanked Karnataka BJP leaders for supporting her nomination and said that she will dedicate herself to serving Karnataka.

135.title: PMC announces financial aid for care of mentally disabled people
135.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced financial aid for registered voluntary organisations catering to mentally disabled patients in its jurisdiction. Under PMC's 'Disabled Welfare Scheme', annual aid of ₹24,000 will be paid to such organisations to take care of at least 15 mentally challenged persons. The amount may also be paid to parents of children dealing with mental illness.

136.title: We happen to look good together naturally: A$AP Rocky on Rihanna
136.article_body: Rapper A$AP Rocky, speaking about his relationship with Rihanna, said, "I think it's just natural. We happen to look good together naturally." "It would take a lot of work to have us forcefully match before we leave the house," he added. Earlier this month, the duo welcomed a baby boy. Rihanna and Rocky have been dating since early 2020.

137.title: Hardik Pandya's captaincy was similar to Dhoni: Sanjay Manjrekar
137.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar has said that Gujarat Titans skipper Hardik Pandya's captaincy in IPL 2022 was similar to that of MS Dhoni. "Hardik bowled well...He captained the team like MS Dhoni. R Sai Kishore bowled the 16th and 18th overs in the final," Manjrekar noted. He added that Pandya "made the decisions according to match situations".

138.title: Pune Zilla Parishad launches project to upgrade 102 primary health centres
138.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad has launched a project to upgrade the 102 primary health centres (PHCs) across the district. Furthermore, it plans to add 12 more PHCs. PHCs are the "bedrock of public health", the body's CEO Ayush Prasad said. The CEO also claimed that Pune now has the "most number of PHCs in any district of India."

139.title: Mumbai civic body chief IS Chahal empanelled as Secretary by govt
139.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal and Mumbai Port Trust Chairman Rajiv Jalota are among the two senior bureaucrats in Maharashtra who have been empanelled in the rank of Secretary by the central government. Notably, Chahal was earlier praised by the Supreme Court for handling the oxygen crisis during the second wave of COVID-19.

140.title: No one can kill his voice: Arshi Khan on Sidhu Moosewala's killing
140.article_body: Former 'Bigg Boss' contestant and actress Arshi Khan mourned the demise of Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa district on Sunday. "I'm sure no one can kill his voice and he'll be celebrated with his songs," she said. "It wasn't...personal loss but it was a loss for our country," Arshi said, adding, "Culprits must be punished."

141.title: It's as close to winning a WC as you can get: GT's Wade on IPL 2022 triumph
141.article_body: Reacting to his team winning IPL 2022, GT's Matthew Wade said, "It's [as] close to winning a World Cup as you can get. It was a crazy atmosphere and something I'll never forget – 1,04,000 people." "This one has got all the glitz and glamour on it...they do it differently over in India and...put on a show," added Wade.

142.title: Railway police saves man who fell off moving train at Prayagraj station
142.article_body: A Government Railway Police (GRP) Head Constable, Ramu Yadav reportedly saved the life of a man who fell off a moving train at the Prayagraj railway station. The mishap happened when the man was sitting at the gate of a coach. Uttar Pradesh Police also shared a video of the incident on Twitter, hailing Yadav's alertness.

143.title: Philippines protests against China's fishing ban in South China Sea
143.article_body: The Foreign Ministry of the Philippines said that it has filed a diplomatic protest with China for imposing a temporary fishing ban in the country's Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) in the South China Sea. The fishing moratorium is aimed at regenerating fish stocks. Notably, China and the Philippines have overlapping territorial claims in the South China Sea.

144.title: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain sent to ED custody till June 9
144.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was on Tuesday sent to the Enforcement Directorate's (ED) custody till June 9 in an alleged money laundering case. This comes after the ED arrested Jain on Monday in the case, which pertains to hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company.

145.title: Another home irreparably damaged by violence: Omar on J&K teacher’s killing
145.article_body: After a Kashmiri Pandit teacher was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir, ex-J&K CM Omar Abdullah on Tuesday said that another home has been irreparably damaged by violence. "She lost her life in a despicable targeted attack," Abdullah tweeted. The deceased woman, 36-year-old Rajni Bala, was a resident of Samba in Jammu region.

146.title: LIC share price drops over 3% after its Q4 net profit falls 17%
146.article_body: The share price of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) dropped over 3% on Tuesday after the insurer's consolidated net profit in the January-March quarter of FY22 dropped 17%. LIC's stock price dropped 3.23% on the BSE and 3.31% on the NSE on Tuesday. The stock price has fallen about 15% from its IPO issue price of ₹949/share.

147.title: I struggle to lift even 2kg at gym post radiotherapy: Chhavi Mittal
147.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal has revealed that she struggles to lift even 2 kg dumbells at the gym after undergoing radiotherapy sessions. Chhavi added that she takes her physiotherapy classes at the gym as well. The actress further said, "I want to tell everybody going through something difficult, please just face it with a smile. It makes a lot of difference."

148.title: PMC to mark World Environment Day with cleanliness drive
148.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will mark World Environment Day this year by organising 'Plogathon 2022 Mega Drive', which will be held on June 5. As many as 134 roads in the city, as well as various hill spots and riverside ghats, will be cleaned during the drive, local media reported. The drive will commence from 7 am onwards, PMC tweeted.

149.title: Police detain 32 foreign nationals for overstaying in Bengaluru
149.article_body: In a special drive, Bengaluru City Police raided several places in the city to find overstaying foreigners and nationals without valid documents, according to a report. During the drive, police detained 32 overstaying foreign nationals, including 19 males and 13 women. All the detained foreign nationals are being questioned and necessary legal action is being taken, a police statement read.

150.title: Moosewala's father stands with folded hands as thousands join singer's funeral march
150.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh was seen thanking the late singer's thousands of supporters who joined his funeral procession in his native village in Punjab on Tuesday. Singh was seen standing on the tractor carrying Moosewala's mortal remains, with folded hands. The 28-year-old singer and Congress leader was cremated in the presence of his family and fans.

151.title: Why did Enforcement Directorate arrest Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain?
151.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on Monday in an alleged money laundering case. The agency alleged that Jain was involved in hawala transactions with a Kolkata-based firm in 2015-16. Earlier, the CBI alleged that Jain and his family set up four shell firms to launder ₹11.78 crore in 2010-12 and ₹4.63 crore in 2015-16.

152.title: Moosewala's father holds his turban in his hands to thank crowd at son's cremation
152.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's father held his turban in his hands to thank thousands of people who had gathered at village Moosa in Punjab's Mansa for his son's cremation. Sidhu Moosewala was cremated in his agricultural field instead of the village cremation ground. He was shot dead on May 29.

153.title: Ranbir's fans get crane to put garland on him in Visakhapatnam, video surfaces
153.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and director Ayan Mukerji on Tuesday flew off to Visakhapatnam to promote their upcoming film 'Brahmastra'. A video has surfaced online showing a massive garland made of marigold flowers being placed around Ranbir with the help of a crane. Ranbir and Ayan were also showered with flower petals as soon as they stepped out of the airport.

154.title: Looking forward to watching with family: Aamir on sister Nikhat's TV debut
154.article_body: Aamir Khan took to the official Instagram handle of his production house to congratulate his sister Nikhat Khan who'll make her TV debut with the show 'Banni Chow Home Delivery'. "My very best wishes to Nikhat...Looking forward to watching with my family. Love...Aamir," he wrote. Nikhat has previously appeared in films like 'Lahore Confidential' and 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'.

155.title: BJP-led central government 'adulterated', destroying economy: Mamata
155.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee called the BJP-led central government "adulterated" and accused it of mismanaging country's economy. "They've destroyed...country's economy through disastrous decisions like demonetisation. It was a big scam," she said while addressing a meeting of TMC workers in Purulia district on Tuesday. She added that BJP is trying to silence opposition through central agencies.

156.title: YouTuber raises ₹33 lakh funds for temple renovation without permission in TN, held
156.article_body: Police arrested a Tamil Nadu-based YouTuber, Karthik Gopinath, for allegedly illegally raising funds over ₹33 lakh for the renovation of temples controlled by the state government without permission. He also collected money in his personal account, police added. The complainant, an official of a temple in Siruvachur, alleged Gopinath wrongfully used the money for his own purpose.

157.title: Old video of Sidhu Moosewala saying 'I am targeted, might die any day' surfaces
157.article_body: An old video of singer-politician Sidhu Moosewala has surfaced online wherein he talked about death. "I don't have a specific aim in life. I have been targeted many times. I might die any day but I am not scared of death," he had said in the video. Moosewala was shot dead on Sunday.

158.title: CCI probing alleged nexus between e-comm firms, their sellers: Report
158.article_body: Competition Commission of India's (CCI) investigation arm is reviewing documents that suggest financial dealings between leading e-commerce companies and their preferred sellers, the Economic Times reported. The documents were reportedly found during raids on vendors last month following allegations that Amazon and Flipkart violated competition law. The CCI arm has sought time to review documents.

159.title: I ensured that I live each moment to the fullest at Cannes: Hina Khan
159.article_body: Actress Hina Khan, speaking about her experience at Cannes Film Festival 2022, has said, "Once I was there, there was so much happening." She added, "I ensured that I live each moment to the fullest and enjoy my time there and not just rush through it." Hina unveiled the poster of her film 'Country of Blind' at the film festival.

160.title: Don't like night matches on clay: Nadal on QF match timings against Djokovic
160.article_body: Spain's Rafael Nadal has commented on the night session timings during which his French Open quarter-final match against Serbia's Novak Djokovic is scheduled to be played on Tuesday. "I don't like to play on clay during the night because the humidity is higher, the ball is slower and there can be very heavy conditions especially when it's cold," Nadal said.

161.title: Sidhu Moosewala's murder symbolic of AAP's 'misgovernance': Lekhi
161.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Meenakashi Lekhi on Tuesday criticised the AAP-led Punjab government over Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's murder. "This is not the first murder, it is the 90th murder since they (AAP) have come to power," Lekhi claimed. She further alleged that the murder was "symbolic of misgovernance going on in the state".

162.title: Water supply to be disrupted in Hyderabad for 24 hours on June 1
162.article_body: The water supply in parts of Hyderabad will be disrupted for 24 hours from 6 am on June 1 (Wednesday). The water cut has been scheduled due to repair work on freshwater supply lines, the Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board announced. The affected areas include Gandipet, Narsingi, Manchirevula, Manikonda and Kokapet.

163.title: Turkey summons German & French envoys over Kurdish militant events
163.article_body: Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu said the German and French ambassadors to Ankara were summoned to the country's Foreign Ministry to protest events organised by the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) in those nations. Turkey, US and the European Union consider PKK a terrorist organisation. Separately, Turkey has said it opposes Sweden and Finland's NATO bids for harbouring Kurdish militants.

164.title: Hardik was a big gamble by GT, Miller a massive one: Sanjay Manjrekar
164.article_body: Talking about GT's IPL 2022 triumph having beaten RR in the final, cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said, "[Captain] Hardik Pandya [was a] big gamble, [batter] David Miller [a] massive gamble." "What [a] return from these guys," added Manjrekar. Hardik scored 487 runs and picked eight wickets in IPL 2022. Miller scored 481 runs at a strike rate of 142.72.

165.title: Biplab Deb's removal as CM proves BJP govt is non-performing: TMC
165.article_body: TMC General Secretary Kunal Ghosh on Monday asked the BJP to reveal why former Tripura CM Biplab Deb was removed from his post. "The removal of Biplab Kumar Deb has substantiated the Trinamool Congress' allegation that the BJP dispensation is a non-performing government," he said. Notably, BJP's Manik Saha was recently named as CM of Tripura.

166.title: After not being fielded for RS, Naqvi likely to contest LS polls: Report
166.article_body: Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi is likely to be fielded by the BJP for the Lok Sabha bypolls from the Rampur constituency, ANI reported. Notably, Naqvi, whose Rajya Sabha tenure is going to end in July 2022, has not been listed by the BJP as its candidate for the Rajya Sabha biennial election scheduled for June 10.

167.title: Unusual to have such massive snowfall: Zarina on shooting for Ishq Pashmina
167.article_body: Speaking about shooting for the film Ishq Pashmina, actress Zarina Wahab said that it was unusual to have such a massive snowfall. "I've worked outstations and experienced weather problems before, but this was something I hadn't experienced," she added. "Locals came to our aid, whether it was clearing the snow or ensuring...the areas were always clear for us," Zarina said.

168.title: 6 members of interstate gang involved in train thefts arrested in Pune
168.article_body: The Pune Rural Police has busted an interstate gang from Delhi and Haryana that was involved in several bag-lifting cases and cellphone thefts in railway stations and trains across India. Six members of the gang have been arrested. Police recovered fake Aadhaar cards, stolen cellphones, 48 SIM cards and a cutter used to break chains from their possession.

169.title: Indian-American Congressman honoured with Distinguished Leadership Award
169.article_body: Indian-American Congressman Raja Krishnamoorthi has been honoured with the Distinguished Leadership Award in recognition of his outstanding career and dedication to public service. Illinois State Secretary Jesse White presented the award to the Democratic leader. Krishnamoorthi, who was born in New Delhi, has been serving as US representative for Illinois' 8th congressional district since 2017.

170.title: Lawrence Bishnoi moves Delhi HC fearing 'fake encounter' in Moosewala killing
170.article_body: A day after a court refused to entertain Lawrence Bishnoi's plea to stop the transfer of his custody to Punjab Police, the jailed gangster approached the Delhi High Court. Bishnoi, who is a suspect in singer Sidhu Moosewala's killing, has alleged he feared a fake encounter by Punjab Police. He is currently lodged in Delhi's Tihar Jail.

171.title: Got married too young, I understand marriage better now: Kanika
171.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor, who recently got married to businessman Gautam Hathiramani, has spoken about her first marriage. She said, "I got married earlier at a very young age and today I understand this institution much better." Kanika further said that sometimes one can be in a marriage with a partner who doesn't understand you, adding that it's not anybody's fault.

172.title: Nigerian drug peddler held in B'luru, drugs worth ₹8 lakh seized
172.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru City Police has arrested a Nigerian drug peddler and seized drugs worth ₹8 lakh from his possession, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Tuesday. The seized drugs include 60 grams of MDMA crystals and six grams of cocaine. Police have also recovered a mobile phone from his possession.

173.title: Sidhu Moosewala cremated in his native village in Punjab, thousands attend funeral
173.article_body: Singer-politician Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead on Sunday, was cremated in his native village Moosa in Punjab's Mansa district on Tuesday, with thousands attending his funeral. As per the police, Goldy Brar, a member of Lawrence Bishnoi gang hailing from Canada, has claimed responsibility of Moosewala's murder. Moosewala's family has sought a CBI probe in the killing.

174.title: Hyd police detain house burglar in drive against habitual offenders
174.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Monday detained a "notorious" inter-state house burglar under the PD Act in a drive against habitual offenders. The accused and his associate have been robbing houses in Karnataka, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh since 2017, police said. In April, police had recovered ornaments, phones, cash and a car worth a total of ₹32 lakh from the accused.

175.title: 250 coffins with mummies unearthed in Egypt, pics surface
175.article_body: Egypt on Monday displayed a trove of ancient artefacts dating back 2,500 years that the country's antiquities authorities said were recently unearthed at necropolis of Saqqara near Cairo. The find includes 250 coffins with well-preserved mummies inside, 150 bronze statues of ancient deities and bronze vessels used in rituals. The objects date back to the Late Period, about 500 BC.
