351.article_body: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on Monday condemned the physical assault on Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait in Bengaluru and stated that the incident has "exposed BJP's intellectual bankruptcy". "Assault on...Tikait is a testimony to BJP's inability to face opponents on ideological basis," Siddaramaiah tweeted. Tikait was attacked with black ink at a press meet in the city today.

352.title: Ashish Nehra creates history, becomes 1st Indian to win IPL title as head coach
352.article_body: GT head coach Ashish Nehra has created history by becoming the first Indian to win IPL title as head coach. Nehra is also the fourth person after Shane Warne, Darren Lehmann and Ricky Ponting to win an IPL title both as player and head coach. He had won IPL title as a player while being part of SRH in 2016.

353.title: GT hold roadshow in Ahmedabad to celebrate IPL 2022 victory, pics go viral
353.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) held a roadshow at the Sabarmati Riverfront in Ahmedabad on Monday to celebrate their victory in IPL 2022. Scores of fans gathered on the streets for the roadshow. Earlier today, Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel felicitated Gujarat Titans and presented a memento to their captain Hardik Pandya. GT had defeated Rajasthan Royals (RR) in the final on Sunday.

354.title: Pics show damages after heavy rainfall in Delhi as AC, hoardings, trees fall on cars
354.article_body: Several cars in Delhi were left damaged when trees, hoardings and an air-conditioner fell on them in separate incidents after heavy rainfall and hailstorm, accompanied by strong winds, lashed the city on Monday evening. As seen in visuals that have surfaced online, the canopy at the Vijay Chowk in Rajpath had also toppled during the thunderstorm.

355.title: It'll be a monumental effort for Nadal to win French Open: Auger-Aliassime
355.article_body: Ninth seed Felix Auger-Aliassime, who stretched Rafael Nadal to five sets before losing the 2022 French Open fourth round, said it'll be a "monumental effort" for the 13-time champion to win the title this week. He added that Nadal's quarter-final match against Novak Djokovic will be "difficult". Nadal beat Auger-Aliassime 3-6, 6-3, 6-2, 3-6, 6-3 in four hours 21 minutes.

356.title: 100 killed in clashes between gold miners in Chad last week: Govt
356.article_body: Around 100 people were killed in clashes between gold miners in northern Chad on May 23 and May 24, Defence Minister General Daoud Yaya Brahim said on Monday. About 40 others were injured in the clashes, he added. All people from the informal gold mining site in Kouri Bougoudi district are being evacuated, he further said.

357.title: 'Jersey' director once said 'Nobody will be interested in you': Shahid
357.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that 'Jersey' director Gowtam Tinnanuri told him after a shot that he is worried since the film is about him but nobody will be interested in his character. "He said, 'After seeing your dad (Pankaj Kapur's) take, you think anybody is going to look at you in the scene? He's so good'," Shahid added.

358.title: Apple's iPhone 14 Pro series could get 'Always-on Display': Report
358.article_body: Apple's iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max could get the 'Always-on Display' feature, Moneycontrol reported citing Bloomberg. The feature will allow iPhone to turn down frame rate significantly on the lock screen and display quickly glanceable information. The other features that the new iPhone Pro series models may have include an A16 chip and a 48-megapixel back camera.

359.title: I understand disappointment of those who didn't clear UPSC but they'll make a mark: PM
359.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday talked about UPSC civil services aspirants who couldn't clear the exam, saying, "I fully understand [their] disappointment." He added, "I also know that these are outstanding youngsters who will make a mark in any field they pursue and make India proud." The 2021 final exam results were declared on Monday.

360.title: 8 years of govt have been about fulfilling people's aspirations: PM
360.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said the last eight years of his government have been about fulfilling people's aspirations. "We are committed to fulfilling our pursuit of Seva, Sushasan and Garib Kalyan," PM Modi said. He shared a link to a section on the NaMo app that showcases his government's eight years of service through innovative ways.

361.title: China's Shanghai to lift 2-month-long COVID-19 lockdown on June 1
361.article_body: Authorities in China's Shanghai will lift the city's two-month-long lockdown from midnight on June 1. Reacting to the news, a Chinese social media user said, "I'm so emotional that I'm going to cry." "The epidemic situation in our city has been effectively controlled and the situation continues to improve," the Shanghai city government said in a statement.

362.title: Mann doesn't deserve to remain CM: SAD leaders to Punjab Governor
362.article_body: A day after Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's murder, Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leaders met Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit to seek the dismissal of CM Bhagwant Mann. "[Mann] is pushing [Punjab] back into...anarchy. We also demand NIA probe into...killing," SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal tweeted. Punjab government will set up a judicial commission to probe Moosewala's death.

363.title: No doubt RSS flag will become national flag one day: Eshwarappa
363.article_body: Former Karnataka Minister KS Eshwarappa on Sunday said there's no doubt that the RSS flag "will become the national flag someday". "To bring out the sense of sacrifice, RSS does prayers by keeping the saffron flag in the front," Eshwarappa said. "We don't have to hoist the tricolour whenever [Congress tells] us," he added.

364.title: I'm grateful for Malti, want to be a thoughtful father: Nick on daughter
364.article_body: Singer Nick Jonas revealed that after becoming a father the "weight of everything is much more intense". Speaking about his daughter Malti Marie, Nick said, "I think it's now about trying to be as present as possible and as thoughtful as you can be for your family." "I'm...grateful for [Malti] and the wonderful perspective of being a parent," he added.

365.title: Nigeria reports 1st death due to monkeypox this year, 21 cases
365.article_body: Nigeria has reported its first fatality due to monkeypox, along with 21 confirmed cases this year, the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) said on Sunday. "The death was reported in a 40-year-old patient who had underlying co-morbidity and was on immunosuppressive medications," CDC added. Monkeypox infections have been reported in at least 23 countries so far, according to WHO.

366.title: After U-19 World Cup, winning the IPL is just as big: GT opener Gill
366.article_body: Following GT's maiden IPL title win, opener Shubman Gill said, "It means a lot. After winning the Under-19 World Cup, winning the IPL is just as big." Gill, who scored an unbeaten 45 off 43 balls, was the leading run-scorer for GT in their seven-wicket win against RR on Sunday. Gill scored 483 runs throughout the IPL in this season.

367.title: SpiceJet fined ₹10 lakh for using faulty simulator to train Boeing 737 Max pilots: Report
367.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Monday imposed a penalty of ₹10 lakh on private carrier SpiceJet, on the charge of utilising faulty simulator to train pilots of Boeing 737 Max aircraft, according to reports. The training imparted by SpiceJet using the faulty simulator could have "adversely affected flight safety", the DGCA reportedly stated.

368.title: If India need a captain in 2 years I wouldn't look past Hardik: Vaughan
368.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya for leading GT to IPL 2022 title in their debut season, Michael Vaughan said "If India need a captain in a couple of years I wouldn't look past Hardik." He added it's a "fantastic" achievement for a new franchise. Hardik was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 3/17 and 34(30) in the final against RR.

369.title: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain arrested by ED in alleged money laundering case
369.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was on Monday arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in a money laundering case, officials said. The case pertains to hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company, the officials added. The agency had in April attached properties worth ₹4.81 crore linked to Jain, in connection with a money laundering case.

370.title: Union Minister Rijiju's daughter sings Rafi's song, video surfaces
370.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Monday took to Instagram to share a video of his daughter singing 'Yeh Hai Bombay Meri Jaan', a song sung by legendary singers Geeta Dutt and Mohammed Rafi. In the video, she can be heard singing the song along with another classic 'Oh, My Darling Clementine'. Union Minister Smriti Irani reposted the video on Instagram.

371.title: Anil Kapoor marks 25yrs of 'Virasat'; shares pics with Tabu, Pooja
371.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor on Monday took to Instagram to mark 25 years since the release of his film 'Virasat'. The actor shared a series of stills from the film, writing, "Dedicating the 25th Year of my personal favourite film Virasat to one of the best producers I have ever worked with! #MushirRiaz." The film starred Pooja Batra and Tabu.

372.title: Sudan lifts state of emergency imposed since last year's coup
372.article_body: Sudan on Sunday lifted a state of emergency that was imposed after a military coup in October last year. The decision was taken to create the right atmosphere to achieve stability during the transitional period, the Transitional Sovereign Council said. Separately, the Security and Defence Council had recommended the release of all detainees who were arrested under it.

373.title: Arguably the best team this season: Yuvraj on GT after their IPL 2022 win
373.article_body: Congratulating GT following their title win in IPL 2022, Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Arguably the best team this season!" He added, "Outstanding tournament for Hardik Pandya and Shubman Gill. Not long before he [Shubman] gets into the T20 national side. Last but not the least Ashish Nehra ji hanste-hansate cup utha liya." GT won the title in their first-ever IPL season.

374.title: 7-yr-old girl found dead in Mumbai hotel; mother unconscious, father missing
374.article_body: A seven-year-old girl's body was found inside a hotel room in Mumbai's Mira Road area. Her mother was found unconscious and her father, who had checked in with them, is missing. According to police, initial investigations suggest that the father tried to kill his daughter and wife in the hotel, but the wife somehow managed to escape.

375.title: This isn't Afghanistan, it's not allowed to own guns: Karan on Moosewala's death
375.article_body: Actor Karan Kundrra reacted to Sidhu Moosewala's murder and expressed grief. He said, "We tweet and mourn but a mother lost her son to such a horrific situation. I saw a few videos and the visuals were so gory that it would hurt your heart deeply." "It's not allowed to own guns just like that...This is not Afghanistan," he added.

376.title: BSP won't contest Rampur LS bypoll nor support anyone: Mayawati
376.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati said that party won't contest Rampur parliamentary constituency bypoll, nor will it support any other party on seat. She, however, added that BSP will contest Azamgarh bypoll with "full strength". Bypolls on these seats are being held as SP's Akhilesh Yadav and Azam Khan resigned as MPs from these seats after winning in 2022 UP Assembly polls.

377.title: Dalit staffer barred from using tumbler, toilet at TN govt office, 6 booked
377.article_body: Six employees of Tamil Nadu's Public Works Department have been booked under sections of the SC and ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act for allegedly harassing a colleague from the Dalit community. The victim was allegedly abused, restricted from using a tumbler that his colleagues used for drinking water, denied access to the toilet and barred from using the office computer.

378.title: Trees uprooted as heavy rains with strong winds lash Delhi; pics surface
378.article_body: Trees were uprooted in several areas of Delhi as heavy rains coupled with strong winds at a speed of 50 km per hour lashed the city on Monday. Trees were also uprooted at BJP MP Parvesh Verma's residence at Janpath Road, damaging his car. In Connaught Place, a car was trapped under an uprooted tree.

379.title: Lawrence Bishnoi moves court fearing encounter by Punjab Police in Moosewala murder
379.article_body: Jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, who's one of the prime suspects in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala, has moved an NIA court fearing a fake encounter by Punjab Police. Bishnoi is currently lodged in Delhi's Tihar Jail and has sought to stop Punjab Police from gaining his custody. Bishnoi's gang member Goldy Brar is also a suspect in Moosewala's killing.

380.title: Newly-listed LIC's Q4 net profit falls 17% to ₹2,409 cr, declares ₹1.5 dividend
380.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) on Monday reported that its consolidated net profit fell 17% year-on-year to ₹2,409 crore in the quarter ended March 2022. The company earned a net premium of ₹1.44 lakh crore during the quarter, while its revenue increased to ₹2.12 lakh crore. LIC, which listed on the bourses this month, announced a dividend of ₹1.5.

381.title: Archie characters are iconic, I'm nervous making the film: Zoya
381.article_body: Filmmaker Zoya Akhtar has stated in an interview that she is a little nervous making 'The Archies' because the characters from the comic books are "iconic and globally loved". The filmmaker further said, "I have to make sure the film stokes the nostalgia of a generation that grew up on the comic and yet resonates with young adults today."

382.title: Atul Kataria Chowk flyover opened to traffic from Gurugram to Delhi
382.article_body: The Public Works Department (PWD) on Sunday opened one carriageway of Gurugram's Atul Kataria Chowk flyover to traffic coming from Gurugram to Delhi. "The flyover is likely to become fully operational by June 15," said PWD Superintending Engineer (B&R) Parveen Chaudhary. The traffic coming from Delhi to Gurugram bus stand will continue to use the service lanes.

383.title: Delhi Police to question gangsters in Tihar for 'plotting' Moosewala's murder
383.article_body: The Delhi Police on Monday said it will interrogate gang leaders lodged in Delhi's Tihar Jail for allegedly plotting the murder of singer-politician Sidhu Moosewala from inside the prison.  Canada-based gangster Goldy Brar has claimed responsibility for the murder and said it was planned by him and the Lawrence Bishnoi group. Bishnoi is currently lodged in Tihar jail number 8.

384.title: It's a promotion, not hike: Kartik on claim he'll charge ₹40cr after 'Bhool...' success
384.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has denied a report that claimed he has hiked his fees to ₹35-40 crore per movie after the success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. Calling the report "baseless", Kartik said, "Promotion hua hai life mein. Increment nahi (I've been promoted in life, haven't got an increment)." The film is this year's fifth Hindi movie to cross ₹100-crore earnings.

385.title: Left envelope with ₹1 lakh cash at vendor in Indore: Kamya Punjabi
385.article_body: Television actress Kamya Punjabi revealed in an interview that she was recently in Indore and went to try pani puri. She added that she had an envelope containing ₹1 lakh cash with her which she mistakenly left there. "My friend rushed to the place...[and] he found my packet at the spot where we had left it," the actress said.

386.title: Biggest celebration happened when I met my fans: Kartik on 'Bhool...' success
386.article_body: Speaking about celebrating the success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', Kartik Aaryan said he had gone to Gaiety Cinema in Mumbai. "My biggest celebration for the film happened on the first weekend of the release itself. I had gone to the Gaiety cinema and met the fans," he added. "I danced with them and asked them about the film," he said.

387.title: Need to examine if Uniform Civil Code affects human rights: Khurshid
387.article_body: Congress leader Salman Khurshid on Monday commented on the proposed implementation of the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) by some states, stating the need to examine if UCC affects human rights. "Whether it is Uniform Civil Code or anything else, it must meet the requirements of...Indian Constitution," he added. Uttarakhand government has formed a five-member panel to prepare draft on UCC.

388.title: Man dressed as elderly woman throws cake at Mona Lisa painting in Paris
388.article_body: A man disguised as a wheelchair-bound elderly lady lunged and threw cake at the Mona Lisa painting, which was behind the protective bulletproof glass at the Louvre Museum in Paris. While being escorted by security guards, the man shouted, "Some people are trying to destroy the earth, think of the earth!" He also threw roses on the floor.

389.title: Once, a child called me Rahul Gandhi: Akhilesh in UP Assembly
389.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader Akhilesh Yadav on Monday narrated an incident in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly from the time when he was the Chief Minister. "I asked a child if he knew who I was. The child said, 'Yes, you are Rahul Gandhi'," he said. Several leaders in the Assembly laughed over this.

390.title: 99% of pre-monsoon nullah-cleaning work complete in Mumbai: BMC
390.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has completed 99% of pre-monsoon nullah-cleaning work, according to official data. "Initially, work of desilting was going on at a slow pace but after contractors were penalised, the work began being carried out in full swing," an official said. "The remaining work will be completed in the next couple of days," the official added.

391.title: Sun Pharma posts ₹2,277 crore net loss in Q4 FY22
391.article_body: Sun Pharmaceuticals Industries on Monday reported a net loss of ₹2,277.38 crore in Q4 FY22, compared to the net profit of ₹894 crore a year ago. Its revenue from operations in Q4 rose 11% YoY to ₹9,446.76 crore. The firm's sales in India rose 16% YoY to ₹3,095.60 crore while its spending on research and development stood at ₹543.30 crore.

392.title: PM Modi's approval ratings rise to highest since the start of pandemic: Survey
392.article_body: Approval ratings of PM Narendra Modi's government have risen to the highest since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic at 67%, according to a survey conducted by LocalCircles, which polled 64,000 people. That's a jump from 51% last year and 62% in 2020 when the pandemic started. Around 73% said they were optimistic about their and families' future in India.

393.title: Parmeet's career had slow start: Archana on being more successful than husband
393.article_body: Actress Archana Puran Singh spoke about having a bigger career than that of her husband, Parmeet Sethi. She said Parmeet has been a mature person. "Although his career had a slow start, he has done good work in...films," she added. "He...established himself in his career but remained in the background, so it seemed...I did better in my career," Archana said.

394.title: 5 including minor drown in dam backwaters in Gujarat's Narmada
394.article_body: Five people drowned after they entered the backwaters of the Karjan dam in Gujarat's Narmada district. The deceased included an eight-year-old boy, his parents and another couple, police said. The incident, which took place near Mandan village, happened at 6 pm on Sunday but four out of the five bodies were recovered on Monday morning, police added.

395.title: Over 2,800 people arrested following 24-day drug bust in Brazil
395.article_body: Officials in Brazil's Sao Paulo on Sunday seized 13.6 tonnes of drugs and arrested over 2,800 people following a 24-day drug bust, which is part of government's 'Operation Choke' initiative. As many as 427 stolen vehicles were also recovered by police amid the ongoing anti-crime drive. The number of security personnel patrolling Sao Paulo's streets was reportedly hiked to 9,700.

396.title: My goal is to make films for families to watch: Kiara Advani
396.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani has stated in an interview that her goal is to make films now which warrant a community watching experience that families can go and watch. The actress further said that with success she has gained clarity and has found her own voice. Kiara added that playing unique characters was always on her wish list.

397.title: Align admission procedure to our policy: DU to St Stephen's College
397.article_body: Delhi University on Monday asked St Stephen's College to align its admission procedure with the university's policy. This comes after the college earlier said it'll accord 85% weightage to Common University Entrance Test's (CUET) score and 15% to physical interviews. Adding score based on an interview to the CUET score will "eventually lead to discrimination", said DU Registrar Vikas Gupta.

398.title: Saffron flag may become national flag someday: KS Eshwarappa
398.article_body: Former Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa on Sunday said that the saffron flag didn't get its "respect today or yesterday", but that it has a "history of thousands of years". "The saffron flag may become the national flag...today or someday. There is no doubt in it," he added. Furthermore, he said that the saffron flag is "a symbol of sacrifice".

399.title: Custody of B'luru's Madiwala Lake handed over back to forest dept
399.article_body: After the Karnataka Forest Department made repeated requests to the state government, the custody of Madiwala Lake in BMT Layout in Bengaluru has been handed over back to the department. The lake's custody was with the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) since 2019. An official from Forest Department said, "We would like to start boating once again in the lake."

400.title: Rain, hailstorm lash parts of Delhi; flights affected, wind leaves cars shaking
400.article_body: Parts of Delhi witnessed a hailstorm and heavy rainfall on Monday evening, which led to disruption of traffic movement at several places in the city. Flight-tracking websites reportedly showed several passenger planes circling over Indira Gandhi International Airport, waiting for the weather to clear. As per reports, strong winds left cars shaking on roads.
